name: Dallas Mavericks
history: Founded as an expansion team in 1980, the Mavericks have called Dallas home for their entire history, moving to the American Airlines Center in 2001. The franchise underwent a transformation under the ownership of Mark Cuban, leading to a decade of dominance and a 2011 NBA Championship led by Dirk Nowitzki. The team has a tradition of embracing international stars, a legacy that began with Nowitzki and continues today with Luka Dončić. Known for their 'MFFL' (Mavs Fan For Life) community, the team remains a cornerstone of the North Texas sports landscape.
fun_facts: Dirk Nowitzki played 21 seasons for the Mavericks, setting an NBA record for most seasons played with a single franchise.
Mark Cuban bought the team in 2000 for $285 million; the team is now valued at over $5 billion.
The team name 'Mavericks' was chosen by fans over options like 'Wranglers' and 'Express'.

They are one of the few teams to have retired a number for a player who never played for them (Brad Davis #15... wait, Brad Davis did play for them. Kobe Bryant #24 is the correct non-player retired number).
Luka Dončić recorded a 60-point, 20-rebound, 10-assist triple-double in 2022, a feat never before seen in NBA history.
